Women's Garment Sizing Chart

All my patterns are based on the following metric measurements

Bone Couture garments use the bust measurement in centimetres to define jackets, dresses, shirts and waistcoats, and waist measurement defines skirts and trousers

Measurement in centimetres
 Usual ease allowances
in garments
Bust 82 86 90 94 98 103 10cm
Waist 60 64 68 72 76 81 1cm: skirt/trouser
4cm: bodice/jkt
Hip [20 cm from waist] 87 91 95 99 103 108 5cm
Rib cage [under bust] 68 72 76 80 84 89  
Neck/collar 36 37 38 39 40 41  
Nape-Waist 40 40.5 41 41.5 42 42.5  
Nape-Bust 24 24.2 24.4 24.6 24.8 25  
Sleeve length 56.4 57.2 58 59.6 60.4 61.2  
Waist-Knee 58.4 59.2 60 60.8 61.6 62.4  
Waist-Floor 100 101.5 103 104.5 106 107.5  
height 159 161.5 164 166.5 169 171.5  

Please note that I grade at 4cm increments as is usual in the UK and Europe rather than the 5cm (2") increments used by most US and Australian manufacturers as I find it better suited to my close fitting designs.
My designs favour a petite hour-glass figure, as that is my own figure-type, though my patterns are cut closer to standard proportions. I can provide a full made to measure service to anyone with a figure-type that doesn't fit the standard: please contact me for details on how to measure yourself.
